**Wikipedia summary**:  
<p class="mw-empty-elt">
</p>

<p><i><b>Fragaria vesca</b></i>, commonly called the <b>wild strawberry</b>, <b>woodland strawberry</b>, <b>Alpine strawberry</b>, <b>Carpathian strawberry</b> or <b>European strawberry</b>, is a perennial herbaceous plant in the  rose family that grows naturally throughout much of the Northern Hemisphere, and that produces edible fruits.
</p><p>The Latin specific epithet <i>vesca</i> may mean "thin, feeble", however</p>...
